holidays.name: Lithuanian State Restoration Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the re-establishment of an independent State of Lithuania on 16 February 1918. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lithuanian_State_Restoration_Day

holidays.name: Estonian Independence Day
holidays.info: Anniversary of the Estonian Declaration of Independence in 1918. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(Estonia)

holidays.name: Liberation Day
holidays.info: Commemorates the liberation of Bulgaria from Ottoman rule in 1878. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberation_Day_(Bulgaria)

holidays.name: Saint Patrick's Day
holidays.info: Cultural and religious holiday celebrating Saint Patrick (c. 385 – c. 461 AD), the foremost patron saint of Ireland. https://www.ireland.com/en-us/what-is-available/culture-and-heritage/articles/st-patricks-day/

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.info: Commemorates the start of the War of Greek Independence in 1821. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(Greece)

holidays.name: Europe Day
holidays.info: Celebrates peace and unity in Europe. https://europa.eu/european-union/about-eu/symbols/europe-day_en

holidays.name: Constitution Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the signing of the Norwegian Constitution in 1814. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_Day_(Norway)

holidays.name: National Day
holidays.info: Commemorates the election of Gustav Vasa as King of Sweden in 1523, as well as the adoption of the new constitution in 1809. https://visitsweden.com/what-to-do/culture-history-and-art/swedish-traditions/national-day/

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.info: Celebrates Finland's declaration of independence from Russia in 1917. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(Finland)

holidays.name: National Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the founding of the Republic of Iceland in 1944. https://guidetoiceland.is/history-culture/national-day-of-iceland

holidays.name: Bastille Day
holidays.info: Commemorates the Storming of the Bastille on 14 July 1789, a turning point of the French Revolution. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastille_Day

holidays.name: National Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the founding of the Swiss Confederacy in 1291. https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/events/swiss-national-day/

holidays.name: Saint Stephen's Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the foundation of the Hungarian state by Stephen I, its first king. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Stephen%27s_Day_(Hungary)

holidays.name: Restoration of Independence Day
holidays.info: Commemorates the adoption of the Constitutional Law on the Status of the Republic of Latvia, which re-established Latvia's independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Restoration_of_Independence_Day

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the day when Malta achieved its independence from Britain in 1964. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(Malta)

holidays.name: German Unity Day
holidays.info: Commemorates the anniversary of German reunification in 1990. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_Unity_Day

holidays.name: National Day
holidays.info: National holiday of Spain commemorating the anniversary of Christopher Columbus's arrival in the Americas. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Day_of_Spain

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the anniversary of the restoration of Poland's sovereignty as the Second Polish Republic in 1918. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(Poland)

holidays.name: Great Union Day
holidays.info: Celebrates the unification of Transylvania, Bessarabia, and Bukovina with the Romanian Kingdom in 1918. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Union_Day
